intro: Onoseris squarrosa, commonly known as the woolly dandelion, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and parts of Canada. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk florets. The plant is recognized by its hairy, grayish-green leaves and yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in dry, rocky soils and is often found in open habitats such as meadows and grasslands. Onoseris squarrosa is an herbaceous perennial that plays a role in supporting local pollinators and maintaining ecological balance in its native range.
